Package Event

Interface EventContainer

All Known Implementing Classes:
PEC
public interface EventContainer
EventContainer.java This interface defines the methods for managing a container of events in a priority queue, providing methods to add, poll, peek, and remove events based on certain criteria.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
  • ArrayDeque
  • Map
  • Predicate

  • Method Details

    • addEvent

      void addEvent(GenericEvent event)
      Adds an event to the priority queue.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to be added.

    • poolEvent

      GenericEvent poolEvent()
      Polls an event from the priority queue.
      Returns:
      The event with the highest priority.

    • peekEvent

      GenericEvent peekEvent()
      Peeks at the event with the highest priority without removing it from the queue.
      Returns:
      The event with the highest priority.

    • getEventQueue

      ArrayDeque<GenericEvent> getEventQueue(int max_time)
      Gets an ArrayDeque of multiple events that have a time below a certain threshold. This can be used to get all the events that have happened from a previous timestamp to the current.
      Parameters:
      max_time - This is the maximum time that we will be wanting to remove from the PriorityQueue.
      Returns:
      ArrayDeque containing all the events that should be handled currently.

    • removeEvents

      void removeEvents(Predicate<GenericEvent> e)
      Remove all the objects from the Queue that follow a certain Filter
      Parameters:
      e - Filter That will be used to remove the object

    • get_num_events

      Integer get_num_events()
      Gets the number of events in the priority queue.
      Returns:
      The number of events.

    • getEventCounter

      Map<String,Integer> getEventCounter()
      Gets the event counter-map.
      Returns:
      The event counter-map.

    • setEventCounter

      void setEventCounter(Map<String,Integer> eventCounter)
      Sets the event counter-map.
      Parameters:
      eventCounter - The event counter-map.

    • size

      Integer size()
      Gets the size of the priority queue.
      Returns:
      The size of the priority queue.
